title: Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC)
description:
Implement Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) System

Build a comprehensive ABAC authorization system that dynamically evaluates permissions based on user attributes, resource attributes, and contextual information at runtime.

Requirements:
- Design an attribute schema defining user attributes (role, department, clearance level, etc.), resource attributes (owner, classification, type, etc.), and context attributes (time, location, IP address, etc.)
- Create a policy definition language or structure for expressing ABAC rules (e.g., "allow if user.department == resource.department AND context.time is business_hours")
- Implement a policy evaluation engine that processes attributes against defined policies to grant/deny access
- Build an attribute provider system to fetch attributes from various sources (user database, resource metadata, request context)
- Support combining multiple policies with conflict resolution (deny-override, permit-override, etc.)
- Provide caching mechanism for attribute lookups and policy evaluations to minimize performance impact
- Create an audit logging system to track all access decisions with full attribute context
- Build administrative interface for managing policies and viewing attribute mappings
- Include policy testing/simulation tools to validate rules before deployment

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Missing or null attribute values in evaluation
- Performance with large policy sets and high request volumes
- Handling attribute value changes mid-session
- Circular dependencies in attribute resolution
- Time-based or temporary attribute values

Success Criteria:
- Sub-100ms authorization decision latency for typical requests
- Support for at least 100 concurrent policy evaluations
- Complete audit trail for compliance requirements
- Clear policy conflict resolution with predictable outcomes
